content.description: Stewart Green's excellent guidebook gives this unknown climb a 5.11 rating.  My daughter tried it and believes it is much harder than 5.11.  The protection is good, but there is not much to work with on the overhanging section above the obvious hold at the 3rd bolt.  It is a tough climb.
content.location:
This is a short climb up a blunt, overhanging prow about 25 feet right of the wavy slab containing

Sunkist

and

Cleavage

.

content.description: Start with a reachy move to gain a ledge, then follow the seam/crack until it peters out and the angle steepens. Crank through the crux zone and work your way onto "The Ramp". A final headwall with positive but pumpy holds guards the anchors. Old school bolt spacing adds some excitement!
content.location: Located a couple hundred feet left of the Sunkist Slab, this route climbs up the middle of a pear shaped face. It is the second bolted line to the right of the obvious Intimidator Roof crack. Start at a small pine tree growing off the ledge.

content.description: This climb has well placed bolts and a few interesting moves up the left side of a wavy slab in the middle of Springer Gulch Wall.
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: This is on the left side of the wavy slab in the middle of Springer Gulch Wall (see photo).

content.description: Climb up the left side of a ribbon face, steep and crimpy face climbing with some Kansas City shuffle.  It has interesting but fun moves.
content.protection:
5 bolts or 6 bolts to bolted anchors.

Per

Glenn Schuler

: the bolting is on the sporty side if you don't take any supplemental gear. Some micro nuts, a green & red Camalot make it less runout.
content.location:
This is just right of

Kokopelli

and starts up a ramp.

content.description:
This route is just left of

Surfing with the Alien

.

Start on the slab, doing 5.11ish slab moves clipping a half dozen bolts until you get to the obvious crux roof. The roof is well-protected, and there is a good chance that there is already a bail biner there. I had to use it. I got real close to getting my self up over the roof, but I just couldn't get my feet established on the face above. It looks like some crimpy, sustained moves to the anchors once your above the roof, but I will have to come back for another go before I can confirm that. This has great position on the Intimidator Roof. It is well-bolted and well-protected.
content.location:
It is the next route left of

Surfing with the Alien

on the Intimidator Roof.

content.description: Start on a very bicep-y undercling slanting 45 degrees to the right, and do a big move up to a slightly slopey ledge (not nice to shorter climbers). Proceed with moves behind on huge jugs with a mantel topout.
content.location: Take the Springer Gulch Wall approach, and turn right at the base of the wall. Ascend up an obvious and steep couloir, and your destination will be halfway up.

content.description: This is a pretty straightforward climb with a definite crux at about the 3rd bolt.  I thought the crux was tough and only was able to do it because I was tall enough (5' 10") to reach a good hold after edging up a couple feet on a couple of crimps and thin feet.  However, my daughter (5'5") climbed the route with ease -- but she's a much better climber than me :-)
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the wavy slab next to

Sunkist

.

content.description: This is the leftmost route on the right side of Springer Gulch Wall, it starts behind a couple of tall pines. This is a vertical face to a steep prow. There are anchors above on a ledge.
content.location: This is the first leftmost route on the right side of Springer Gulch Wall.

content.description: Go up a blunt arete feature and move right at a small roof with a crack in the corner. A bolt left requires balancing on the face below the roof and then move up to bigger holds. There are 4 bolts.
content.location: It is in the Intimidator Roof area of Springer Gulch Wall.

content.description:
This is about 100 feet left of the Sunkist Alcove slab and directly left of

Bill and Britt Two

. A steep section gives way to a juggy, easy finish. There are three bolts. As of 8-19-12, beware of the detatched rock near the top ready to fall on your belayer and also you. A good prybar session is in order (see the photo to the right).

Per

Ben Peterson 2

: the loose block has been cleaned off.
content.location: It is in the Intimidator Roof area of Springer Gulch Wall.
